abstract: Members of the Newspaper Guild were voting all day Monday over a package of pay cuts.
snippet: Members of the Newspaper Guild were voting all day Monday over a package of pay cuts.
lead_paragraph: BOSTON — Throughout the day in a third-floor room at the Boston Globe, members of the Boston Globe Newspaper Guild have been voting about whether to accept a package of pay cuts that the newspaper’s owner, The New York Times Company, insists is necessary to keep the money-losing paper in business. The 12-hour window for voting is to close at 8 p.m., with the results to be released shortly thereafter.

headline.main: Voting Under Way at Boston Globe Over Proposed Pay Cuts
